question:
Consider the following differences between Critical “wildlife” habitats (CWLHs) and Critical “tiger” habitats (CTHs):
  1. While CTHs are identified under Wildlife Protection Act, 1972, CWLHs are defined only in the Forest Rights Act, 2006
  2. While CTHs are notified by the state government in consultation with expert committee, CWLHs can be notified only after the consent of the respective Gram Sabha
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Both are correct statements Critical “tiger” habitats (CTHs) are known as core areas of tiger reserves. These are identified under the Wild Life Protection Act (WLPA), 1972. CTHs are notified by State Governments in consultation with expert committee. CWLHs are defined only in the Forest Rights Act, 2006. They can be notified only after the consultation of Gram Sabha.
